footer.description: Eager-to-learn Frontend dedicated Web Developer characterized with a keen eye for design and a passion for creating user-friendly and visually appealing websites.

about.title: About me
about.description: I'm a frontend developer based out of Montreal, CA.  I love building apps that solve real-world problems, and that are delightful to use. My specialities include TypeScript, React JS, CSS, Styled Components and more.
about.paragraphOne: My background is much more oriented Frontend by building Front-end of websites and web web applications to deliver a smooth and appealing user experience. However, I do have some backend knowledge, mainly from my degree in programming from Maisonneuve College.
about.paragraphTwo: I am into programming since many years, check out some of my work in the Projects section.
about.paragraphThree: I'm open to  job opportunities where I can contribute, learn and grow. If you have a good opportunity that matches my skills and experience then don't hesitate to contact me.

projects.title: Projects
projects.description: Some of my personal projects, including links to the code and live version. Click the button to learn more about each one.

projectOne.title: Quiz App
projectOne.description: Quizzie is a simple quiz app that lets you select alternatives and then gives you a score. It's built with functional React components.

overview.firstParagraph: Quizzie is a React application built from scratch as part of a React training course. The project's original prerequisites were pretty basic for my taste, so I decided to push it further to make it more complete and to be truly satisfied.
overview.secondParagraph: Although a simple transition in itself doesn't necessarily require a great deal of effort, I made the task more complex by aiming to improve much more the project by implementing new functionalities thanks to the panoply of tools available in React. In particular, the ability to add a translation, compartmentalize code into several distinct components, have several pages in SPA, use styled components etc...
overview.thirdParagraph: With a view to perfecting it, I've implemented several options. Among these, the possibility of choosing your own question theme, the number of questions and, above all, a modern approach by compartmentalizing the questions into different panels. An optimization I didn't see in the dozen or so different projects I consulted from other program participants.
overview.checkLinkParagraph: Feel free to consult the source code via the link below. I'd be delighted to hear from you, either for your personal uasge or to give you some advice.

projectTwo.title: Wild Oasis
projectTwo.description: The Wild Oasis is a user friendly hotel management application. This application is designed to manage hotel operations, including sales statistics, cabin management, user management, booking management, and various customization options. And so much more!

overview.firstParagraph: This massive application was realized in the course of a Udemy project, built from merely nothing. As for the rest, all the functionality and architecture was built step by step. The aim of the project was to be very faithful to an application that could be found in the real world by real companies, thus guaranteeing meticulous design and UX.
overview.secondParagraph: In addition to the heavy workload involved, this project stood out for its versatility, having to employ both front-end and back-end, with all data being generated through queries to a database on supabase. It was a great exercise in getting used to working in harmony with the two facets of web development.
overview.thirdParagraph: To log in as a user, enter usertest@test.com and passworduser for the credentials.
overview.checkLinkParagraph: N'hésitez pas à consulter le code source avec le lien plus bas. Que ce soit pour votre uasge personnal ou apporter conseils, je les recevrai avec grand plaisir.

projectThree.title: Portfolio
projectThree.description: This portfolio that you are currently watching comes mainly from an Open Source portfolio coded on HTML, CSS and vanilla JS. I then enhanced it in React and added several features such as translation and routings. I aim to make it Open Source and easy to adapt for anyone who'd like a React portfolio.

overview.firstParagraph: This portfolio originally came from an Open-Source project with a neat design, but limited architecture and capabilities due to its deployment in HTML and JavaScript vanilla. With a view to honing my React skills, I migrated the project to React in order to optimize it.
overview.secondParagraph: Although a simple transition in itself doesn't necessarily require a great deal of effort, I made the task more complex by aiming to improve much more the project by implementing new functionalities thanks to the panoply of tools available in React. In particular, the ability to add a translation, compartmentalize code into several distinct components, have several pages in SPA, use styled components etc...
overview.thirdParagraph: My final desire is to make it open-source too, exactly like the original project. But with the addition of my React features to make the project much more powerful and attractive to employers.
overview.checkLinkParagraph: Feel free to consult the source code via the link below. I'd be delighted to hear from you, either for your personal uasge or to give you some advice.

projectFour.title: Manoir Ramezay
projectFour.description: The Manoir Ramezay is a somptuous manor located in Quebec. I was missioning from their management to single-handedly refactor and modernize their website.

overview.firstParagraph: As the sole developer on this vast project, I was entirely in charge of redesigning the website, with the mission to follow the figma's website with a functional website.
overview.secondParagraph: My most important freelance assignment to date, I take great pride and satisfaction in having seen this long project through to the end, and in having single-handedly taken on the technical difficulties and complications along the way, demonstrating the autonomy I can bring to web development.
overview.thirdParagraph: At my employer's request, this website is still based on modern languages with HTML, CSS, JavaScript and PHP, just like its predecessor.
overview.checkLinkParagraph: For security reasons, I prefer not to publicly disclose the source code.
